title: Burglar cut necklace from grandmother's neck as accomplice pointed knife at her husband's throat
text:
A burglar cut the necklace from a grandmother's neck as his accomplice pointed a knife at her husband's throat during a raid on their home, police said.
The couple, in their late 50s, said they were asleep when the two masked men entered their room in Ilford, east London, in the early hours of Monday.
One attacker put his foot on the woman's chest to restrain her and used a pair of pliers to remove her necklace before ordering her to hand over more jewellery, police said.
The second assailant stood over her husband and pointed a knife at his neck during the robbery in South Park Drive.
The pair fled through the back garden when they were disturbed by other people in the house.
The couple's 20-year-old granddaughter called police, who are yet to make an arrest, shortly before 3am.
Scotland Yard said the attackers wore dark clothing. One was white and the other black and both were in their mid-to-late 20s.
This was a terrifying ordeal for the victims and it has left them extremely distressed.
We are determined to catch those responsible and put them before the courts.
We'd appeal for anyone with any information to contact us as a matter of priority.
